column2: Summer IT Industrial Training is a comprehensive program designed to provide students with practical, hands-on experience in various aspects of the information technology (IT) industry       This training is typically conducted during the summer months when students have an extended break from their academic studies     The primary goal of this program is to bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge gained in academic settings and the practical skills required in the professional IT environment     During the Summer IT Industrial Training, students are exposed to real-world IT projects, technologies, and industry practices under the guidance of experienced professionals     The program often includes a structured curriculum that covers a range of topics such as software development, web development, database management, networking, cybersecurity, and emerging technologies     Participants can expect to enhance their technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and teamwork through hands-on projects, case studies, and practical workshops     Additionally, they may have the opportunity to work with industry-standard tools and technologies, gaining valuable insights into the latest trends and best practices in the IT sector     Furthermore, this training often includes sessions on communication skills, project management, and professional ethics, preparing students for the demands of a dynamic and rapidly evolving IT industry     By the end of the program, participants should have a better understanding of the practical challenges and opportunities within the IT field, equipping them with the necessary skills and confidence to excel in their future careers
column11: Training, Excel, Networking, Database management, Project management, Web development, IT projects, industrial training, Information technology

column2: Skill required:Client Financial Management - Financial Analysis  Designation:Associate Manager  Qualifications:Master of Business Administration  Years of Experience:10 to 14 years  What would you do? The team aligns Finance with Business Strategy in order to maximize operational efficiency and effectiveness by harnessing the power of robotics to accelerate transaction processing, with AI to provide analysis and commentary and machine learning deployed for matching and reconciliations This team is responsible for leading the transformation agenda for our clients by helping them improve finance function performance within the context of their organizations' strategies. The team leads growth and mining in existing F&A accounts for industry segments. This team works across Procure to Pay (PTP), Record to Report (RTR), Order to cash (OTC), Finance Processes FPNA), Tax and Treasury towers to provide best in the class industry view, support existing engagements, diagnostic, due diligence, client co-design workshops, transformation engagement. Qualification-CA, CMA, MBA FPAN, Description-Responsible for financial management - including budgeting & forecasting, contract profit & loss management and advisory services to client and corporate leadership teams Design and implementation of tools and processes which enable the client to perform financial analysis of its statements. Involves the ability to assess materiality and volatility of financial statement line items and key metrics utilizing financial ratios to determine the financial health of the company.  What are we looking for? Financial Planning and Analysis  Ability to manage multiple stakeholders  Written and verbal communication  Problem-solving skills  Budgeting and Forecasting  Financial Consolidation & Close Operations  Pricing & Profitability Optimization Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of moderately complex problems  Typically creates new solutions, leveraging and, where needed, adapting existing methods and procedures  The person requires understanding of the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals  Primary upward interaction is with direct supervisor or team leads  Generally interacts with peers and/or management levels at a client and/or within Accenture  The person should require minimal guidance when determining methods and procedures on new assignments  Decisions often impact the team in which they reside and occasionally impact other teams  Individual would manage medium-small sized teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts
column11: financial analysis, project management, team management, financial management, client liaison, software testing, business analysis, budgeting, account management, strategic planning, estimation, people management skills, stakeholder management, project planning

column2: Skill required:  Social - Service Desk Non-Voice Support Designation:  Customer Contact Comms New Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 0 to 1 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Customer Support vertical and help us in managing/ resolving customers query, handling escalations and complaints of the dissatisfied customers & giving best resolutions. You will also be responsible for closing the fault and complaints within SLA's.Candidate who is good in email and chat process, who is good in typing is what is preferred hereThis role is aligned to our Service Desk Non-Voice Support team which is responsible for recording, diagnosing, troubleshooting, resolving, or assigning incidents and service requests based on a defined scope of support. The team manages unplanned interruptions to restore normal service operations as quickly as possible for non-voice interactions like email, web, and chat. What are we looking for? Customer service representative with good spoken and written communication skills  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your primary interaction is within your own team and your direct supervisor In this role you will be given detailed instructions on all tasks The decisions that you make impact your own work and are closely supervised You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team with a predetermined, narrow scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Job Summary: The Investor Relations Manager is responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive investor relations program. This role involves managing communications with investors, preparing content for annual reports and investor presentations, making presentations for shareholders, and coordinating with internal and external stakeholders to ensure accurate and timely information dissemination. Key Responsibilities:  Investor Communications: Develop and maintain relationships with investors, analysts, and other stakeholders. Respond to inquiries and provide accurate and timely information.  Content Development: Prepare and manage content for annual reports, investor presentations, press releases, and other communication materials.  Financial Reporting: Collaborate with the finance and accounting teams to ensure accurate and compliant financial reporting.  Presentations: Create and deliver presentations for shareholders, analysts, and other stakeholders to communicate the company?? financial performance and strategic initiatives.  Market Analysis: Monitor and analyze market trends, investor sentiment, and competitive landscape to provide insights and recommendations to senior management.  Regulatory Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and disclosure requirements, including those set by the SEC and other regulatory bodies.  Event Management: Plan and coordinate investor events, including earnings calls, investor meetings, and shareholder conferences.  Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with the CFO, senior management, and other departments to ensure consistent and coherent messaging. Qualifications: Education: Bachelor?? degree in Finance, Business Administration, Communications, or a related? field. MBA or relevant advanced degree preferred. Experience: Minimum of 4-6 years of experience in investor relations, financial communications, or a? related field, preferably within the housing finance industry. Skills:  Strong written and verbal communication skills.  Excellent presentation and public speaking abilities.  Proficiency in financial analysis and understanding of financial statements.  Strong project management and organizational skills.  Ability to work effectively under pressure and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.  Knowledge of relevant regulations and compliance requirements. Competencies:  Leadership: Ability to lead initiatives and work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.  Analytical Thinking: Strong analytical skills to interpret financial data and market trends.  Detail-Oriented: Attention to detail in preparing and reviewing communication materials.  Strategic Communication: Ability to develop and execute communication strategies that align with the company?? goals.

column2: Amicorp Management India pvt. Ltd. is looking for Fund Administrator to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Fund Operations Management: Oversee the day-to-day operations of investment funds, including processing subscriptions, redemptions, and transfers, monitoring cash flows, and reconciling investment transactions      Compliance and Regulatory Reporting: Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards, including filing regulatory reports, maintaining compliance records, and implementing procedures to mitigate compliance risks      Investor Services: Serve as a primary point of contact for investors, responding to inquiries, providing account statements, and assisting with account opening, KYC (Know Your Customer), and AML (Anti-Money Laundering) procedures      NAV Calculation: Calculate and validate Net Asset Values (NAVs) for investment funds, ensuring accuracy and timeliness in NAV reporting, and collaborating with valuation providers and auditors as needed      Financial Reporting: Prepare financial statements, fund performance reports, and investor communications, ensuring accuracy and compliance with accounting standards (eg, GAAP, IFRS) and regulatory guidelines      Corporate Governance: Coordinate and facilitate board meetings, prepare meeting agendas, minutes, and resolutions, and ensure compliance with corporate governance requirements and fund constitutive documents      Fund Accounting: Maintain accounting records, general ledgers, and trial balances for investment funds, performing periodic reconciliations, accruals, and adjustments, and assisting with year-end audit processes      Risk Management: Monitor investment portfolio risks, liquidity positions, and counterparty exposures, and assist in implementing risk management strategies and controls to mitigate operational and financial risks      Technology and Systems Integration: Utilize fund administration platforms and software tools to streamline operational processes, enhance data integrity, and support business continuity and disaster recovery plans

column2: Position Overview: We are looking for an exceptional Growth & Fundraising Manager with a background in management consulting and experience in the startup ecosystem. The ideal candidate will be a graduate or postgraduate from IIT, IIM, or ISB, with a proven track record of driving growth and securing funding for startups. Responsibilities: Develop and implement comprehensive growth strategies to expand the companies market presence and drive revenue growth. Conduct in-depth market research and analysis to identify growth opportunities, industry trends, and competitive landscapes. Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to align growth initiatives with company objectives and drive execution. Lead fundraising efforts by developing compelling pitch decks, financial models, and investment proposals to secure funding from investors, venture capitalists, and other funding sources. Build and maintain strong relationships with investors, strategic partners, and industry stakeholders to facilitate fundraising activities and strategic alliances. Monitor key performance metrics and evaluate the effectiveness of growth strategies and fundraising campaigns. Stay abreast of industry developments, regulatory changes, and emerging trends to anticipate challenges and capitalize on opportunities. Qualifications: Graduate or postgraduate from IIT, IIM, or ISB with a degree in Business Administration, Finance, or related field. Minimum of 2 years of experience in management consulting, with a focus on growth strategy and business development. Additional 2 years of experience working with startups, preferably in a growth or fundraising capacity. Proven track record of successfully raising capital for startups or early-stage companies. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas and concepts effectively. Strategic thinker with the ability to develop innovative solutions to drive growth and overcome challenges. Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously. Entrepreneurial mindset with a passion for innovation and driving change. Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience Performance-based bonuses and incentives Comprehensive health benefits package Flexible work schedule and remote work options Opportunity for professional growth and development Dynamic and collaborative work environment If you meet the qualifications and are ready to take on the challenge of driving growth and securing funding for an innovative startup, we want to hear from you!
column11: Growth & Fund raising, Growth & Strategy, Fund management, growth strategies, business development, analytical skills
